comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Oh to have a recording of the conversations between those protagonists on that Bloomsday?  I reckon it would be mighty craic  with a few drams taken along the way!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] According to the account of this first Bloomsday on Wikipedia, "... The pilgrimage was abandoned halfway through, when the weary pilgrims succumbed to inebriation and rancour at the Bailey pub in the city centre..."

comment.author: 79549245@N06
comment._content:
“When one reads these strange pages of one long gone one feels that one is at one with one who once…” 
― James Joyce, Ulysses

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/79549245@N06] Our version could be "When one looks at these strange photos of ones long gone one feels that one is at one with ones who once..."
